app_metadata.description: Woodpecker CI is a simple, yet powerful CI/CD engine with great extensibility.
app_metadata.name: woodpecker-ci

run_as_context.description: Woodpecker CI Server runs as any non-root user.
Woodpecker CI Agent runs as any non-root user.

app_metadata.title: Woodpecker CI

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for Woodpecker CI

attrs.label: Postgres Image (CAUTION)
attrs.description:
If you are changing this after the postgres directory has been initialized,</br>
STOP! and make sure you have a backup of your data.</br>
Changing this will trigger an one way database upgrade.</br>
You can only select newer versions of postgres.</br>
Selecting an older version will refuse to start.</br>
If something goes wrong, you will have to restore from backup.

attrs.label: Database Password
attrs.description: The password for Woodpecker CI Database.

attrs.label: External URL
attrs.description:
The URL that Woodpecker will be accessible from.</br>
Example: </br>
- http://server.ip:30166</br>
- https://server.ip:30168</br>
- https://woodpecker.example.com

attrs.label: Agent Secret
attrs.description: The secret that the built-in agent will use to authenticate with the server.

attrs.label: Allow Registration
attrs.description:
This will allow users from one of the Forges to be able to login for the first time.</br>
Woodpecker does NOT have a built-in user management system.</br>
See https://woodpecker-ci.org/docs/next/administration/configuration/server#forge-and-user-configuration

attrs.label: GitHub Configuration
attrs.description: See https://woodpecker-ci.org/docs/next/administration/configuration/forges/github

attrs.label: Client ID
attrs.description: The client ID for the GitHub application.

attrs.description: The client secret for the GitHub application.

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables for Server Container
Additional Environment Variables for Agent Container
User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Woodpecker CI files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Woodpecker CI files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>

attrs.label: Automatic Permissions
attrs.description:
Automatically set permissions for the host path.
Enabling this, will check the top level directory,</br>
If it finds incorrect permissions, it will `chown` the
host path to the user and group required for the
postgres container.

attrs.label: Additional Storage
attrs.description: Additional storage for Woodpecker CI.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to as a volume.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB/CIFS Share (Mounts a volume to a SMB share)
